CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 22, 1958, pg. 1 reads: "All-White Jury in Beaver Finds: Night Club Owner Guilty Of Bias - win Bias Case - Mrs. Ruth Reed (left), who filed the suit against Beaver Falls night club owner, Steve Pavlovic, who was found guilty of discrimination this week by an all-white Beaver County jury, is shown with (left to right) Frances Moppens, Melba Jean Clark and Iris Johnson, who , together with two other persons, were denied service by Pavlovic last Oct. 10 at his Club Manor night club. - Harris Photo."Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper October 18, 1958, pg. 4 reads: "Supported by State - These four persons, together with two other, who were refused service because of race last year in a Beaver Falls night club, received the solid support of the State Liquor Control Board this week as the agency deemed the denial of service so serious that is suspended the liquor license of Stephan Pavlovic, owner of the Royal Manor, Beaver Falls, who had denied service. The group, composed of (left to right) Mrs. Ruth Reed, Frances Moppens, Melba Jean Clark, and Iris Johnson, also testified to a criminal court jury which later convicted Pavlovic of discrimination and ordered him to pay a $100 fine. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group of men and women, including Ruth Reed, Frances Moppens, Melba Jean Clark, and Iris Johnson, gathered in government office during discrimination trial, Beaver County
